Detailed Description

Represents GPS "sentences" describing a GPS geolocation fix.



Users are strongly encouraged to consider using the binary form when specifying a GPS geolocation fix (see Geolocation). There is no intention of adding any significant capabilities to this class.

See also:
Geolocation

virtual string vrt::GeoSentences::getFieldName ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the name of the given field.

In 90% of cases the field name will be identical to the name used in the applicable get/set function except without the get/set prefix (e.g. "SourceContext" for "getSourceContext"). It is possible to access the names of all fields via the following: 

    for (int32_t id = 0; id < getFieldCount(); id++) {
      // id is the field ID
      getFieldName(id);
    }

In situations where it is desirable to access all available fields, it is faster to use the field ID as this eliminates any string comparisons.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field name.
Exceptions:
VRTException if the field id is invalid.

Reimplemented from vrt::AbstractGeolocation.

Returns:

TimeStamp vrt::GeoSentences::getTimeStamp (  )  const [inline]

Gets the time stamp for the geolocation fix.

Returns:
Since no standard time stamp exists for the sentences, this always returns a null value.
